criterion: Reward for thorough capture of the HPI, including nasal stinging, small amount of pink blood after using two sprays, and patient concern about loratadine-related sleepiness
Reward for documenting the clinician’s detailed education on proper nasal-spray technique (nozzle angled toward ear, one gentle sniff, hold breath, slow mouth exhalation)
Reward for recording the recommendation to use plain saline spray before the steroid to reduce dryness and stinging
Reward for noting dosage guidance: limit fluticasone to one spray per nostril daily and continue loratadine 10 mg once each morning
Reward for including follow-up advice to contact the clinic (message or walk in) if bleeding recurs
Reward for accurately citing current medication names, strengths, and frequencies exactly as listed in the chart, without unwarranted changes
Reward for summarizing the clinician’s reassurance that the mild bleed is technique related and not dangerous
Reward for overall completeness and coherent organization of note sections (HPI, assessment, plan, medications, patient instructions)
Penalize for omitting any major symptom, instruction, or follow-up detail explicitly mentioned in the transcript
Penalize for introducing any medication changes, new conditions, or clinical statements not supported by the transcript or chart
Penalize for copying unrelated or outdated chart information that was not referenced during the encounter
